PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.synopsis: Quick VB about the prisoners and the fate that awaits them. This is mainly used to draw attention to them as the players explore the prison area.
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.how_to_trigger: Plays when approaching the cells of MOO prison that contain prisoners.

AD_FlirtyTiefling.synopsis: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
AD_FlirtyTiefling.how_to_trigger: Free character from their jailbreak cell. The various state nodes in this dialog indicate where you would see particular branches.

AD_TieflingsFreed.synopsis: Wulbren has just bust down the back wall of a prison to very surprised tieflings, who he barks this out at.

AD_TieflingInspection.synopsis: Warden has an exchange with the tieflings in Jail.
AD_TieflingInspection.how_to_trigger: Part of the Warden`s behaviours. With tieflings in jail (on tiefling path, use debug book), wait for Warden to walk up to their cell.

AD_GnomesInJail.synopsis: The gnomes are in jail and discussing their predicament. Wulbren is taking charge and nickles and nimble are doing their best to help.
AD_GnomesInJail.how_to_trigger: Teleport to Moonrise jail, the gnomes should be ADing.

ProdigyBrother.synopsis: Cal is the brother of Lia and Rolan. He was ambushed along with the other tieflings and taken to Moonrise. His brother Rolan is at Last light inn. He is afraid but trying to be strong for the other tieflings, and is determined to save his sister.
ProdigyBrother.how_to_trigger: Teleport to act 2 using the debug book, in act 2 setup choose the tiefling path. Then teleport to the moonrise dungeon - the tieflings will be there.

AD_ProdigiesInJail.synopsis: AD between Cal and Lia in Moonris prison. They are exhausted and being held by murderous cultists of the Absolute.
AD_ProdigiesInJail.how_to_trigger: Deubg set up, tiefling path, teleport to Moonrise prison.

AD_WardenInspection.synopsis: Warden heard the gnomes are up to no good and goes verify by herself. The warden stands outside their cell and essentially taunts them - she thinks they are worthless and will die in the cell.
AD_WardenInspection.how_to_trigger: Talk to the gnomes in MOO prison, then talk to the Warden and tell her about the gnomes and insist she should check.

AD_ToolAccepted.synopsis: Wulbren has asked the player for tools, player has thrown something he can use through the bars.
AD_ToolAccepted.how_to_trigger: Load act 2, teleport to Wulbren (he's in the prison in Moonrise). Speak to wulbren and persuade him you're here to help - he'll ask you to get 'tools'. Spawn an item like a hammer or mace and throw it to him through the bars.

AD_WaitingForGnomes.synopsis: Tieflings will wait for the gnomes to rescue them if the gnome have tools and their back wall is broken down whilst the tieflings are still in their cells.Their out of combat behaviour has them huddle close to their own wall, hoping for rescue.If combat starts, they give in and start smacking the wall as well.

Guard_004.synopsis: Nadi doesn't enjoy being a prison guard but considers it her duty. She tries to reassure the player.

GnomePrisoner_002.synopsis: Nickles is a savant who has an incredible ability to read the earth and stone around him, but is nervous and quite fearful as a person. He is easily frightened. He is imprisoned in moonrise and in the following lines escapes by boat (which he hates)/fights his way out/ and has a general greeting.
GnomePrisoner_002.how_to_trigger: Teleport to the prison in moonrise towers

Boat.synopsis: After Wulbren instigates the escape any escaping prisoners try to make it to the boat and flee Moonrise. This dialogue covers the case in which the boat leaves without the player or joins them in the escape.
Boat.how_to_trigger: Click on the boat in MOO prison tunnels. The boat is a one-way trip to HAV.

ProdigySister.synopsis: This is lia's main dialogue in moonrise towers. She's been taken captive (along with her brother cal) - she doesn't know if her other brother rolan is alive or dead. Lia is brave and used to being in tough situations, but she's terrified for herself anf her brother (and trying to mask it with anger). Her main dialogue occurs with her in a cell and speaking to the player on the other side of the bars. There are additional branches for when she's in one cell and the player was arrested an in the cell next to her.
ProdigySister.how_to_trigger: Teleport to act 2 using the debug book, in act 2 setup choose the tiefling path. Then teleport to the moonrise dungeon - the tieflings will be there.

AD_ProdigySister.synopsis: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers. This is a high stress and tense situation as this character tries to flee murderous cultists.
AD_ProdigySister.how_to_trigger: Free character from their jailbreak cell. The various state nodes in this dialog indicate where you would see particular branches.

FlirtyTiefling.synopsis: Lakrissa is a tiefling from the grove who is usually quiet flirty and mischievious but has been through hell and back. There is a hint of her joyful nature here but she's much more reserved. She is currently imprisoned in moonrise towers. She usually has one liners, but if lia is dead she delivers the main beats about the tiefling rescue.
FlirtyTiefling.how_to_trigger: Teleport to act 2 using the debug book, in act 2 setup choose the tiefling path. Then teleport to the moonrise dungeon - the tieflings will be there.

AD_WardenChase.synopsis: Warden runs out of her post to go after the prisoners.
AD_WardenChase.how_to_trigger: Load scl - speak to wulbren, persuade him that you're here to help, agree to get him tools - throw a hammer to him through the bars - tell wulbren to escape now. Wulbren and the gnomes will bust out the back wall, if they are spotted by the patrolling eyes it will trigger an alarm, the warden will run from her post to chase them and this will trigger.

Wulbren.synopsis: Wulbren is the leader of the Ironhand Gnomes. He is currently imprisoned in moonrise towers. He has the lazy charm of arrogant and the determination and cunning of the leader of a revolution. In this dialogue he offers you the main quest - to free him and the tieflings from the prison. He can speak to you through the bars - either with the player in prison, OR with the player speaking to them from the outside. NOTE: Wulbren pushes hard to charm the player and make them think they're friends. He keeps the friendly and charming mask on tight (dropping it only when he insults the player). We can have the lightest touch of menace in this dialogue, a hint that he's holding something back or that there is more to this than it seems, but it should be a light touch. He is friendly and charming here (the mask will drop back at Haven when he is rescued).
Wulbren.how_to_trigger: the gnomes are always in the prison in moonrise towers

Warden.synopsis: The Warden is a devout follower of the Absolute with an iron will, but also a sense of mischief. When the player approaches, she sees it as an opportunity to play with the player a little bit - like a cat with a mouse.
Warden.how_to_trigger: from tutorialDebug book → Go to Region → Act 2 → SCL → Entry Point Mountain Passteleport S_MOO_PrisonWardenSpeak to her.

AD_ProdigyBrother.synopsis: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
AD_ProdigyBrother.how_to_trigger: Free character from their jailbreak cell. The various state nodes in this dialog indicate where you would see particular branches.

AD_Gnome01.synopsis: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
AD_Gnome01.how_to_trigger: Free character from their jailbreak cell. The various state nodes in this dialog indicate where you would see particular branches.

AD_WardenInCombat.synopsis: Gnomes and tieflings are escaping, but the guards have spotted them and begun combat. These are the warden's lines. She is a powerful and formidable opponent, and is furious with her prisoners for defying her.
AD_WardenInCombat.how_to_trigger: Load Act 2 - teleport to wulbren - perusade him to let you help him - through him a tool through the bars (a hammer for instance) - tell him to escape now. Gnomes will bust out the back wall of the prison, if the guards see the empty cell they, plus the warden, will chase them and begin combat. These are the warden's combat ADs.

AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.synopsis: Plays when she spots no prisoners in the cell.
AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.how_to_trigger: Part of the Warden`s behaviours. Will play when she spots an empty cell.

Guard_002.synopsis: Keris is an upbeat and devout follower of the Absolute and admires the Warden.

AD_TieflingLover.synopsis: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
AD_TieflingLover.how_to_trigger: Free character from their jailbreak cell. The various state nodes in this dialog indicate where you would see particular branches.

AD_Gnome02.synopsis: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
AD_Gnome02.how_to_trigger: Free character from their jailbreak cell. The various state nodes in this dialog indicate where you would see particular branches.

AD_Wulbren.synopsis: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
AD_Wulbren.how_to_trigger: Free character from their jailbreak cell. The various state nodes in this dialog indicate where you would see particular branches.

PAD_CheckingOutBoat.synopsis: Contemplates the presence of a boat in the MOO prison tunnels.
PAD_CheckingOutBoat.how_to_trigger: Plays if players break the chains of the boat and try to use it before prisoners actually are at the scene.

AD_ToolRefused.synopsis: Wulbren has asked the player to get 'tools'. Player has to throw the tool to him in the cell. In this instance, player has thrown something to him he can't use.
AD_ToolRefused.how_to_trigger: Load act 2, teleport to Wulbren (he's in the prison in Moonrise). Speak to wulbren and persuade him you're here to help - he'll ask you to get 'tools'. Throw him something he can't use (like a dagger or shovel) and these will trigger.

GnomePrisoner_001.synopsis: Nimble is a devout and loyal follower of Wulbren (and a bit of a lickarse). He's dedicated to the ironhand gnomes but does not give a crap about anyone else. He is imprisoned in moonrise towers in these lines/fighting his way out/fleeing by boat.
GnomePrisoner_001.how_to_trigger: Go to moonrise prison - he's in the cell with wulbren.

AD_GoToTieflings.synopsis: Wulbren on the way to free the tieflings.
AD_GoToTieflings.how_to_trigger: Do the escape in moonrise, wulbren will say this as he runs to the tieflings.

Lover.synopsis: Danis is a tiefling from the grove who is being held prisoner in Moonrise towers. In his initial dialogue he terrified and frantic and worried about his partner Bex (who the player may have met in last light inn). He is also a back up to get the escape quest if Lia and Lakrissa (two other tieflings) are dead.
Lover.how_to_trigger: Teleport to act 2 using the debug book, in act 2 setup choose the tiefling path. Then teleport to the moonrise dungeon - the tieflings will be there.

PAD_ApproachingPrisoners_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners_0.text: Prisoners. I doubt they'll last long in here.

PAD_ApproachingPrisoners_1.speaker: Player
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners_1.text: Careful. One wrong move and we'll be behind bars with them.

AD_FlirtyTiefling_1.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_1.context: NodeContext: leaving without the player, broken hearted and filled with regret

AD_FlirtyTiefling_3.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_3.context: NodeContext: gritted teeth, trying to break the chains that have tied up the boat. Trying not to panic

AD_FlirtyTiefling_6.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_6.text: I say we leave and never look back.
AD_FlirtyTiefling_6.context: NodeContext: quiet and tense  - waiting by the boat and safe for now, but that could change at a moment's notice

AD_FlirtyTiefling_7.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_7.context: NodeContext: boat is free, fleeing in the middle of  combat and escaping

AD_FlirtyTiefling_8.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_8.text: Thank the gods, I made it!
AD_FlirtyTiefling_8.context: NodeContext: determined and hopeful - run through all of moonrise and just arrived outside (character is about to teleport out of sight)

AD_FlirtyTiefling_10.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_10.text: Gods, that noise! All of Moonrise will be on us soon - hurry!
AD_FlirtyTiefling_10.context: NodeContext: an alarm has just started blaring, knows guards will arrive any moment

AD_FlirtyTiefling_11.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_11.text: A river? Damn it. This way?
AD_FlirtyTiefling_11.context: NodeContext: looking around, frantic but trying to keep his cool

AD_FlirtyTiefling_12.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_12.text: What are we waiting for? Let's go.
AD_FlirtyTiefling_12.context: NodeContext: quiet and tense  - waiting by the boat and safe for now, but that could change at a moment's notice

AD_FlirtyTiefling_13.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_13.text: Don't think about it, just go. Go.
AD_FlirtyTiefling_13.context: NodeContext: running for her life, trying not to panic

AD_FlirtyTiefling_14.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_14.context: NodeContext: calling out to player - doesn't want to leave but knows she won't survive if she waits

AD_FlirtyTiefling_15.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_15.text: Keep them off me! I'll take care of the chains.
AD_FlirtyTiefling_15.context: NodeContext: gritted teeth, trying to break the chains that have tied up the boat. Trying not to panic

AD_FlirtyTiefling_16.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_16.text: The boat's our way out! Move it, move it!
AD_FlirtyTiefling_16.context: NodeContext: running through prison - yelling as she sees a way out

AD_FlirtyTiefling_21.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_21.text: Come on, arsehole! You won't reach the boat - not while I'm breathing!
AD_FlirtyTiefling_21.context: NodeContext: combat has begun, tense but determined

AD_FlirtyTiefling_23.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_23.context: NodeContext: running through a prison - enemies all around you

AD_FlirtyTiefling_25.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_25.context: NodeContext: struggling to break the chains that have tied up the boat (no guarantee of what she'll be using, either barehands or a discovered weapon)

AD_FlirtyTiefling_26.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_26.text: This thing's chained up, hold on.
AD_FlirtyTiefling_26.context: NodeContext: struggling to break the chains that have tied up the boat (no guarantee of what she'll be using, either barehands or a discovered weapon)

AD_FlirtyTiefling_27.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_27.text: There's no time! Get to the boat, or we leave without you!
AD_FlirtyTiefling_27.context: NodeContext: calling out to player - doesn't want to leave but knows she won't survive if he waits

AD_FlirtyTiefling_28.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling_28.text: The boat is ready - let's get out of here. Please.
AD_FlirtyTiefling_28.context: NodeContext: quiet and tense  - waiting by the boat and safe for now, but that could change at a moment's notice

AD_TieflingsFreed_0.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_TieflingsFreed_0.context: NodeContext: yelling with authority and confidence

AD_TieflingInspection_6.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_6.text: You're lucky, you know. It's rare that Disciple Balthazar takes a personal interest in prisoners.
AD_TieflingInspection_6.context: NodeContext: smirking as she speaks to her prisoners - cruel

AD_TieflingInspection_23.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_TieflingInspection_23.text: You're from Elturel, aren't you? Why in the hells are you doing this to us?!

AD_TieflingInspection_8.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_8.text: I am doing this because of Elturel. We were driven out of our homes because we're weak.
AD_TieflingInspection_8.context: NodeContext: determined and authorative - trying to make her fellow tieflings see the power of the absolute

AD_TieflingInspection_11.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_11.text: Through the Absolute, we will be weak no more. You should be grateful to be part of that.
AD_TieflingInspection_11.context: NodeContext: determined and authorative - trying to make her fellow tieflings see the power of the absolute

AD_TieflingInspection_25.speaker: Danis
AD_TieflingInspection_25.text: You saw how they treated us in Elturel. You should be helping us!

AD_TieflingInspection_7.speaker: Cal
AD_TieflingInspection_7.text: You know, the rest I can understand, but you're one of us.

AD_TieflingInspection_20.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_20.text: I am not one of you. Elturel proved what we knew all along - these horns and tail are a curse.
AD_TieflingInspection_20.context: NodeContext: determined and authorative - trying to make her fellow tieflings see the power of the absolute

AD_TieflingInspection_10.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_10.text: The Absolute gave me a new name, a new life. She can do the same for you.
AD_TieflingInspection_10.context: NodeContext: determined and authorative - trying to make her fellow tieflings see the power of the absolute

AD_TieflingInspection_13.speaker: Lia
AD_TieflingInspection_13.text: Pray I never get out of here, Warden - the Absolute won't stop me, or my blade.

AD_TieflingInspection_17.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_17.text: Few survive Disciple Balthazar's experiments. This is your chance to submit to the Absolute - to find peace.
AD_TieflingInspection_17.context: NodeContext: this is, in a strange way, the warden trying to be comforting, even if it comes across cruel

AD_TieflingInspection_4.speaker: Lia
AD_TieflingInspection_4.text: I've found peace. I feel it every time I close my eyes and imagine slitting your throat.
AD_TieflingInspection_4.context: NodeContext: utterly furious at her captor

AD_TieflingInspection_14.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_14.text: Were you as strong as you claim, you wouldn't be here. Neither would your brother.
AD_TieflingInspection_14.context: NodeContext: rubbing salt in the wound of a prisoner, trying her best to break them mentally

AD_TieflingInspection_24.speaker: Cal
AD_TieflingInspection_24.text: Maybe a part of you was always missing, but the Absolute has broken you - throughly.

AD_TieflingInspection_5.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_5.text: You're a lost cause. I only pray you're more useful dead than you were alive.
AD_TieflingInspection_5.context: NodeContext: venom in her voice - she wants her words to hurt

AD_TieflingInspection_26.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_TieflingInspection_26.text: Someone must have loved you - a mother, a father, a lover. What would they say now, if they saw you?

AD_TieflingInspection_15.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_15.text: A nice play, but everyone I loved died screaming in Avernus.

AD_TieflingInspection_2.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_2.text: A now I have the undying love of the Absolute. I pity you will  never know that feeling.

AD_TieflingInspection_16.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_16.text: I am far gentler than Disciple Balthazar. You wish to live? Grow a spine.
AD_TieflingInspection_16.context: NodeContext: rubbing salt in the wound

AD_TieflingInspection_9.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_9.text: Or, if you're very lucky, perhaps he will split you open and sew in a new one.
AD_TieflingInspection_9.context: NodeContext: a venemous smile at her cruel words

AD_TieflingInspection_21.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_21.text: I used to be like you - weak. Frail. But then I found the Absolute. She can help you.
AD_TieflingInspection_21.context: NodeContext: smirking as she speaks to her prisoners - in her own way she's trying to help, but she sees them as lesser

AD_TieflingInspection_19.speaker: Cal
AD_TieflingInspection_19.text: Nice speech, but take it elsewhere.
AD_TieflingInspection_19.context: NodeContext: scared but trying not to be

AD_TieflingInspection_12.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection_12.text: *Sigh.* You'll see the truth soon enough, whether you like it or not.
AD_TieflingInspection_12.context: NodeContext: speaking to fellow tieflings, thinks them lesser than her

AD_TieflingInspection_22.speaker: Danis
AD_TieflingInspection_22.context: NodeContext: pleading with a fellow tiefling to save him

AD_GnomesInJail_2.speaker: Nimble
AD_GnomesInJail_2.context: NodeContext: scared and a little frantic

AD_GnomesInJail_5.speaker: Nickels
AD_GnomesInJail_5.text: There's something evil here. Below, down, down... argh!
AD_GnomesInJail_5.context: NodeContext: scared and panicked, noise of pain at 'argh'. Clutches head briefly

AD_GnomesInJail_8.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_GnomesInJail_8.text: Unless this 'evil' can get us out of here, I don't want to hear about it.
AD_GnomesInJail_8.context: NodeContext: doesn't really give a shit his comrade is scrared - focused on himself and the plan

AD_GnomesInJail_6.speaker: Nickels
AD_GnomesInJail_6.text: The stone - I feel it. Hollow behind the back wall, and beyond... water?
AD_GnomesInJail_6.context: NodeContext: eyes closed, using the stone around him to sense the world beyond his cell

AD_GnomesInJail_3.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_GnomesInJail_3.text: I'd bet my last copper there's a pier nearby.

AD_GnomesInJail_1.speaker: Nimble
AD_GnomesInJail_1.text: This could be our chance, sir.

AD_GnomesInJail_9.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_GnomesInJail_9.text: It's only a matter of time 'til we're served up to the necromancer on a platter.

AD_GnomesInJail_0.speaker: Nimble
AD_GnomesInJail_0.text: We'll get you to Baldur's Gate, sir - I swear it.

AD_GnomesInJail_7.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_GnomesInJail_7.text: Damn straight - without me everything will be for naught. The Ironhand Gnomes must succeed.

ProdigyBrother_0.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_0.text: Don't talk to us. You're just making it worse.
ProdigyBrother_0.context: NodeContext: player has refused to help you - furious

ProdigyBrother_1.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_1.text: I need to focus - these ropes won't untie themselves.
ProdigyBrother_1.context: NodeContext: tense and annoyed - he's in the middle of something

ProdigyBrother_2.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_2.context: NodeContext: waiting by boat - tense. Looking for danger

ProdigyBrother_3.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_3.text: Get us out of here before the necromancer comes back - please.
ProdigyBrother_3.context: NodeContext: afraid but trying not to show it

ProdigyBrother_5.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_5.text: Be ready - if any cultists show up, this will get bloody.
ProdigyBrother_5.context: NodeContext: waiting by boat - tense. Looking for danger

ProdigyBrother_6.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_6.text: If you're not going to help, there's nothing left to say.
ProdigyBrother_6.context: NodeContext: player has refused to help you - furious

ProdigyBrother_7.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_7.context: NodeContext: tense and annoyed - he's in the middle of something

ProdigyBrother_8.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_8.text: Hey! Don't leave us in here.

ProdigyBrother_9.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_9.text: We'll have your back if it comes to a fight - you can be sure of that.
ProdigyBrother_9.context: NodeContext: afraid but determined to live

AD_ProdigiesInJail_10.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail_10.text: It's Rolan - he's probably holed up somewhere planning to burst in, spells ablaze, and rescue us.
AD_ProdigiesInJail_10.context: NodeContext: making a joke, trying to reassure lia that their brother is all right

AD_ProdigiesInJail_8.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail_8.text: I bloody hope not. If he saves us, I'll never hear the end of it.
AD_ProdigiesInJail_8.context: NodeContext: a smile as she thinks of her blowhard brother

AD_ProdigiesInJail_5.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail_5.text: I can't believe Rolan is gone. Gods, just saying it out loud...
AD_ProdigiesInJail_5.context: NodeContext: frantic, looking through the bars, panicked

AD_ProdigiesInJail_12.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail_12.text: Let's focus on escaping, all right?

AD_ProdigiesInJail_11.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail_11.text: We'll give Rolan the send off he deserves - when we're both safe.

AD_ProdigiesInJail_3.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail_3.text: You're right. Let's... let's talk about something else.
AD_ProdigiesInJail_3.context: NodeContext: heartbroken, but knows lia is right

AD_ProdigiesInJail_1.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail_1.context: NodeContext: small laugh and a sad smile at his sister's words

AD_ProdigiesInJail_9.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail_9.text: I'll get us out of here, Cal - even if I need to kill every bastard in this hellspit.

AD_ProdigiesInJail_0.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail_0.text: I know. And I'll be right alongside you if it comes to that.
AD_ProdigiesInJail_0.context: NodeContext: knows his sister would give her life for him, feels the same about her

AD_ProdigiesInJail_7.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail_7.text: We won't let them win. Not now, not ever.

AD_WardenInspection_2.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInspection_2.text: Look at you - filthy, stupid, ignorant. You are lucky we found you.
AD_WardenInspection_2.context: NodeContext: speaking to gnomes. They are her prisoners and she detests them - thinks them less than nothing.

AD_WardenInspection_4.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInspection_4.text: I know what you're doing, and there's little point.

AD_WardenInspection_16.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInspection_16.text: Submit to the Absolute or perish - it's that simple.
AD_WardenInspection_16.context: NodeContext: to the warden this is the easiest choice in the world

Wulbren_240.context: NodeContext: slightly annoyed at player's hesitancy to jump down a hole, trying to convince them to go

Wulbren_190.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_190.text: I'd scamper sharpish - I've seen what the Warden does to the insubordinate. Leave, before she catches you.
Wulbren_190.context: NodeContext: determined and a touch fearful

Wulbren_264.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_264.text: Every situation can be turned to your advantage - remember that.
Wulbren_264.context: NodeContext: confident - this is how he lives his life

Wulbren_128.speaker: Player
Wulbren_128.text: You want my help? Shut it.

Wulbren_253.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_253.text: I'd never presume to comment - only advise.
Wulbren_253.context: NodeContext: doesn't like being told off but is forcing his irritation down, trying to appear helpful to player

Wulbren_31.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_31.text: Look, I'm all out of options, so I'm going to trust you. Don't make me regret it.
Wulbren_31.context: NodeContext: furtive - speaking low. Player was spotted by guards, if it happens again they're done for

Wulbren_181.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_181.text: The necromancer has been hauling people off like cattle. We don't get out, we're dead - us, the tieflings, everyone.
Wulbren_181.context: NodeContext: trying his absolute best to convince the player to side with him - determined, confident

Wulbren_176.speaker: Player
Wulbren_176.text: Here. I found this hammer, is it yours?

Wulbren_228.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_228.text: Blessed, Gaerdal - I never thought I'd see it again. Thank you.

Wulbren_227.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_227.text: The plan is to wait for a quiet moment, then bust out the back wall.

Wulbren_53.speaker: Player
Wulbren_53.text: I have the tools you need - take them.

Wulbren_229.speaker: Player
Wulbren_229.text: Got it. I'll be back soon.

Wulbren_97.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_97.text: Thank you - for fighting back when so few do.

Wulbren_195.speaker: Player
Wulbren_195.text: What do you need tools for?

Wulbren_132.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_132.text: Gaerdal help me - just bring them. Or we're all very, very dead.
Wulbren_132.context: NodeContext: thinks player is an idiot but trying to hide it, trying to convince the player to do as he says

Wulbren_179.speaker: Player
Wulbren_179.text: The Warden would want to hear about this.

Wulbren_137.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_137.text: Tell her - she's already taken my freedom. And there's little worse than that.
Wulbren_137.context: NodeContext: grim and determined - he won't be cowed, not by the player or the warden

Wulbren_60.speaker: Player
Wulbren_60.text: Why don't we fight our way out?

Wulbren_6.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_6.text: Daring is the heart of courage, but we can't risk it - not unless there's no other choice.
Wulbren_6.context: NodeContext: pretending to be impressed by player (he actually just doesn't want to risk dying)

Wulbren_34.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_34.text: Don't let fear cloud your heart, friend. Jump - or risk rotting here with the rest of us.
Wulbren_34.context: NodeContext: trying to convince player to jump down the hole - doing his best to lead and inspire them

Wulbren_50.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_50.text: Listen, your mate nearly got done in by the eyes - there's no time.
Wulbren_50.context: NodeContext: furtive - speaking low. Player was spotted by guards, if it happens again they're done for

Wulbren_73.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_73.text: Your feet fly fast, my friend. Any luck with those tools?
Wulbren_73.context: NodeContext: glad to see player but also knows he's short on time - they need tools and need them now

Wulbren_111.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_111.text: ...Tools. Something that can crack rock - like a hammer. Without it, we're doomed to rot in this hellspit.
Wulbren_111.context: NodeContext: thinks player is an idiot but trying to hide it, trying to convince the player to do as he says

Wulbren_92.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_92.text: Good work - we're gonna wait until it's quiet, then bust out the back wall.

Wulbren_95.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_95.text: Your friend is lending a hand, but I'll not turn down extra help. Got any tools?
Wulbren_95.context: NodeContext: glad to see player but also knows he's short on time - they need tools and need them now

Wulbren_99.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_99.text: You've had a change of heart, have you? I'd question it, but there's no time.
Wulbren_99.context: NodeContext: initially hated player but has changed his mind - an ally is an ally - even if he doesn't like them

Wulbren_110.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_110.text: Not now - this boat is tied up tight.

Wulbren_113.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_113.text: Shouldn't you be assisting the Absolute - perhaps by torturing a sweet grandmother, or brainwashing school children?

Wulbren_122.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_122.text: Walk on, True Soul. I ain't risking a beating for the likes of you.

Wulbren_129.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_129.text: The more you interrupt, the longer this will take.

Wulbren_134.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_134.text: Nimble! Check for gaps, cracks - anything to leverage the rock.
Wulbren_134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Back to the player, speaking to the gnomesNodeContext: determined and confident - used to giving orders and having them followed a she plans his escape

Wulbren_43.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_43.text: Nickels: tools - get creative. This rock is basalt - it'll crack with enough pressure.
Wulbren_43.context: NodeContext: determined and confident - used to giving orders and having them followed a she plans his escape

Wulbren_161.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_161.text: Ah! Don't mind us, True Soul. The back wall is weak - we're working to brace it.
Wulbren_161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns and sees the player. Surpise Ah! And then rallies himself, trying to turn the situation to his advantageNodeContext: Surprise on Ah! sees player, assumes they are the bad guy. Confidently rallies himself and tries to turn the situation to his advantage.

Wulbren_90.speaker: Player
Wulbren_90.text: Are you Wulbren? Barcus sent me.

Wulbren_1.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_1.text: ...Barcus is out here? Didn't think he had the stones.
Wulbren_1.context: NodeContext: a beat - surprise. Barcus is an old friend - one he's had disagreements with.

Wulbren_193.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_193.text: If he sent you, you're no slave to the Absolute. You're a damn wolf among sheep, aren't you?
Wulbren_193.context: NodeContext: quickly realises he can use the player to escape - subtle shift to charming

Wulbren_214.speaker: Player
Wulbren_214.text: That is not how you brace a wall, and we both know it.

Wulbren_55.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_55.text: *Sigh.* Of course one of my own would be my undoing. Fine - we're planning to escape. So, are you gonna run off and tell your little Warden?

Wulbren_206.speaker: Player
Wulbren_206.text: No. I want to help you escape.

Wulbren_56.speaker: Player
Wulbren_56.text: I could tell the Warden, or I could help you - for a price.

Wulbren_210.speaker: Player
Wulbren_210.text: I follow the Absolute, of course I'm going to report this.

Wulbren_22.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_22.text: I wouldn't be so foolish as to think I could escape the Absolute.
Wulbren_22.context: NodeContext: player says he's planning an escape. He casually denies it but is also trying to probe the player

Wulbren_41.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_41.text: The Warden has eyes everywhere. And ears.
Wulbren_41.context: NodeContext: trying to see who's side the player is on

Wulbren_36.speaker: Player
Wulbren_36.text: What if I were here to help you escape?

Wulbren_58.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_58.text: Huh. And why would you be so inclined?
Wulbren_58.context: NodeContext: A beat - wulbren is suspicious of the player but part of him wants to believe the player

Wulbren_224.speaker: Player
Wulbren_224.text: Barcus told me you were here, and asked me to help.

Wulbren_15.speaker: Player
Wulbren_15.text: I know the tieflings imprisoned here - I want to break you all out.

Wulbren_61.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_61.text: Those spitfires? They certainly gave the guards a run for their money. And they'd be a help in the escape...

Wulbren_76.speaker: Player
Wulbren_76.text: Accept my help or die in this pit - choose.

Wulbren_237.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_237.text: All right, all right! Gods, remind me not to get on your bad side.
Wulbren_237.context: NodeContext: Surprised by player's ferocity but also impressed

Wulbren_194.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_194.text: Like you care what happens to the likes of us.
Wulbren_194.context: NodeContext: player has tried to persuade you - you don't believe them

Wulbren_35.speaker: Player
Wulbren_35.text: Helping you hurts the Absolute - and I take pleasure in that.

Wulbren_104.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_104.text: Remind me to stay on your good side.
Wulbren_104.context: NodeContext: Surprised by player's ferocity but also impressed

Wulbren_87.speaker: Player
Wulbren_87.text: I am sworn to a higher power - I infiltrated this place just to undermine the Absolute.

Wulbren_32.speaker: Player
Wulbren_32.text: My mind is my own - the Absolute has no control over me.

Wulbren_26.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_26.text: The Absolute thinks she's got you by the scruff of the neck, but it's the other way round, isn't it?
Wulbren_26.context: NodeContext: a beat and then a slow smile - the player has impressed wulbren

Wulbren_185.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_185.text: I reckon you and I were meant to meet - I'm Wulbren.

Wulbren_244.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_244.text: We've got a plan, for us and the tieflings both, but we're scuppered without the right equipment.
Wulbren_244.context: NodeContext: determined, confident - with the player on his side his plan can work

Wulbren_83.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_83.text: We've a plan - but all the determination in the world is nothing without the right equipment.
Wulbren_83.context: NodeContext: determined, confident - with the player on his side his plan can work

Wulbren_4.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_4.text: We need tools. That headcase of a Warden robbed ours, but anything that breaks rock will do - even if it's not Ironhand quality.
Wulbren_4.context: NodeContext: determined, confident - with the player on his side his plan can work

Wulbren_201.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_201.text: Whatever you find, throw it through the bars. But for the love of Gaerdal make sure a guard doesn't see you - or we're both done for.
Wulbren_201.context: NodeContext: determined, confident - with the player on his side his plan can work

Wulbren_79.speaker: Player
Wulbren_79.text: Let's talk escape plan - what do you need?

Wulbren_146.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_146.context: NodeContext: determined, confident and a touch ferocious - with the player on his side his plan can work

Wulbren_63.speaker: Player
Wulbren_63.text: How did you end up in here?

Wulbren_243.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_243.text: All that matters is how we're gonna get out - us and the tieflings both. An Ironhand leaves no one behind.
Wulbren_243.context: NodeContext: determined and a touch ferocious

Wulbren_102.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_102.text: All that matters is how we're gonna get out.
Wulbren_102.context: NodeContext: determined and a touch ferocious

Wulbren_175.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_175.text: The prettiest words hide the damndest lies.
Wulbren_175.context: NodeContext: player has tried to persuade you - you don't believe them

Wulbren_52.speaker: Player
Wulbren_52.text: I'm an undercover agent for the Flaming Fist.

Wulbren_149.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_149.text: ...You're bound for Baldur's Gate, then? Our paths align.

Wulbren_248.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_248.context: NodeContext: player has tried to persuade you - you don't believe them

Wulbren_27.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_27.context: NodeContext: dismissive - done with the convo and not impressed with the player

Wulbren_86.speaker: Player
Wulbren_86.text: You'll owe me a favour after. Besides - I never liked prisons much.

Wulbren_88.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_88.text: Me neither. Nasty little boxes too often used to quash genius.

Wulbren_24.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_24.text: Lies, lies lies - I owe your sort nothing.
Wulbren_24.context: NodeContext: player has tried to persuade you - you don't believe them

Wulbren_145.speaker: Player
Wulbren_145.text: Fine, die in here for all I care.

Wulbren_127.speaker: Player
Wulbren_127.text: I could help you - for a price.

Wulbren_170.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_170.text: Were I to get such help, I'd be appreciative. But why would a True Soul be offering?
Wulbren_170.context: NodeContext: A beat - wulbren is suspicious of the player but part of him wants to believe the player

Wulbren_261.speaker: Player
Wulbren_261.text: And I'm one of those ears.

Wulbren_147.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_147.text: Makes sense. Your eyes are dull - obedient. Why don't you run along and go play with your Warden?
Wulbren_147.context: NodeContext: grim and disgusted with player

Wulbren_13.speaker: Player
Wulbren_13.text: Shh. I'm going to get you out of here.

Wulbren_230.speaker: Player
Wulbren_230.text: Don't bother trying - you're going to die here.

Wulbren_114.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_114.text: I've been in worse spots - and I ain't dead yet. Move along, True Soul.

Wulbren_138.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_138.text: You ordered that guard about as if you were the Absolute herself. What do you want with us, exactly?
Wulbren_138.context: NodeContext: impressed but suspicious - trying to figure out the player's motives

Wulbren_54.speaker: Player
Wulbren_54.text: I'm here to help you escape.

Wulbren_38.speaker: Player
Wulbren_38.text: I could help you get out of here - for a price.

Wulbren_232.speaker: Player
Wulbren_232.text: I just want to torment you in peace.

Wulbren_223.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_223.text: Nice try, but I'm no motherless babe - have your fun with someone else.
Wulbren_223.context: NodeContext: player has tried to scare him, but he's having none of it. Proud, brazen and determined

Wulbren_140.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_140.text: The Absolute turned her back on you, did she? Don't take it to heart - it'll happen to the rest of them in due time.
Wulbren_140.context: NodeContext: player refused to help wulbren earlier. Trying to make the player see that the the two of them are on the same side.

Wulbren_150.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_150.text: Hey - hey! You're the one who has Moonrise up in arms, aren't you?
Wulbren_150.context: NodeContext: all of moonrise is on alert - he's panicked and worried

Wulbren_238.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_238.text: Look - the guards are on a rampage, and we're next on the chopping block.
Wulbren_238.context: NodeContext: panicked - desperately trying to sway player

Wulbren_187.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_187.text: I can smell the blood from here.
Wulbren_187.context: NodeContext: panicked - desperately trying to sway player

Wulbren_29.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_29.text: The guards are out for blood - and their eyes are on us.
Wulbren_29.context: NodeContext: panicked - desperately trying to sway player

Wulbren_156.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_156.text: A new neighbour? If you're locked up in here, you must be doing something right.
Wulbren_156.context: CinematicNodeContext: (note - player is in the cell next to wulbren) NodeContext: sees player in the cell next to his - calling out, assuming him and player are on the same side

Wulbren_37.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_37.text: If it gave the Absolute and her cronies a headache all I can say is - well bloody done.

Wulbren_131.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_131.text: 'Cause I'm hoping you'll return the favour.
Wulbren_131.context: NodeContext: determined charming and confident - trying to get the player on his side

Wulbren_254.speaker: Player
Wulbren_254.text: That doesn't look suspicious at all.

Wulbren_51.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_51.text: It's not without risk, but the same can be said for all great causes.
Wulbren_51.context: NodeContext: determined charming and confident - trying to get the player on his side

Wulbren_106.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_106.text: I've a plan that'll make all of Moonrise rue the day they met us.
Wulbren_106.context: NodeContext: determined charming and confident - trying to get the player on his side

Wulbren_266.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_266.text: Help me and we'll stick it to the Absolute - together.
Wulbren_266.context: NodeContext: determined charming and confident - trying to get the player on his side

Wulbren_17.speaker: Player
Wulbren_17.text: If it ruins the Absolute's day, I'm in.

Wulbren_12.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_12.text: Determined? Good - we'll need it. Now, go - before the guards see.

Wulbren_105.speaker: Player
Wulbren_105.text: What do I get out of it?

Wulbren_173.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_173.text: Other than the joy of saving lives? I know powerful people in Baldur's Gate - and I remember my friends.
Wulbren_173.context: NodeContext: this is the truth - he's incredibly influential and he'll use it

Wulbren_204.speaker: Player
Wulbren_204.text: I promise nothing - thanks for the tip about the hole though.

Wulbren_89.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_89.text: ...You're welcome. If you change your mind, I'll be here - not that I have much choice.
Wulbren_89.context: NodeContext: player has refused to help. He wants to push the player harder but forces himself to leave it

Wulbren_117.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_117.text: Ain't one in my cell, friend, or I'd be long gone. Luckily, I've a plan to get out.
Wulbren_117.context: NodeContext: determined charming and confident - trying to get the player on his side

Wulbren_28.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_28.text: Not surprised - the egos around here are made of bloody glass.

Wulbren_126.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_126.text: Fair enough. I just figure with the two of us in a cell, we might have a common enemy.
Wulbren_126.context: NodeContext: player got aggresive, he's trying to turn the situation to his advantage

Wulbren_136.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_136.text: We'll grab the tieflings along the way - we'll need 'em if it comes to a fight.

Wulbren_191.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_191.text: You, however, are the clincher. Once we move, keep the patrols busy. If the bastards spot us, all of bloody Moonrise will come down on us.

Wulbren_101.speaker: Player
Wulbren_101.text: Hold in your cell until I return.

Wulbren_192.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_192.text: How long does it take to untie a boat?
Wulbren_192.context: NodeContext: tense and annoyed - just wants to leave

Wulbren_198.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_198.text: We're low on time - the guards are spooked and will be watching us both. I've got a plan, if you're up to the task.
Wulbren_198.context: NodeContext: furtive - speaking low. Player was spotted by guards, if it happens again they're done for

Wulbren_200.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_200.text: We'll move once it's quiet - until then, be ready.

Wulbren_212.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_212.text: Blasted eyes did a number on your friend, but there's still hope.
Wulbren_212.context: NodeContext: furtive - speaking low. Player was spotted by guards, if it happens again they're done for

Wulbren_213.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_213.text: What in the Nine Hells have you done? Moonrise has lost its damn mind - and we're next on the cutting block.

Wulbren_241.speaker: Player
Wulbren_241.text: In my defence, it was an accident.

Wulbren_8.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_8.context: NodeContext: Furious. "Gaerdal" = GAIR-dul. Gaerdal is a deity, so expressed like "God help me."

Wulbren_188.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_188.text: We need to get out of here or we're stone dead. Get us tools, anything that could crack the wall behind us.
Wulbren_188.context: NodeContext: panicked - desperately trying to sway player

Wulbren_239.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_239.text: Or find a way to get this damn door open. Hurry!
Wulbren_239.context: NodeContext: panicked - desperately trying to sway player

Wulbren_169.speaker: Player
Wulbren_169.text: I have something that can break stone.

Wulbren_162.speaker: Player
Wulbren_162.text: Got it - I'll be back soon.

Wulbren_10.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_10.context: NodeContext: trying not to sound to frustrated that the job isn't done - wants player to hurry

Wulbren_221.speaker: Player
Wulbren_221.text: I don't have time for this. You're on your own.

Wulbren_217.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_217.text: Enjoy being in the Absolute's pocket. I'm sure it's nice and cosy.

Wulbren_7.speaker: Player
Wulbren_7.text: Stop whining - at least I'm fighting back against the Absolute.

Wulbren_125.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_125.text: At what cost? Do we deserve the knife for your folly?

Wulbren_215.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_215.text: About time - any luck with those tools?
Wulbren_215.context: NodeContext: a little frantic, violence is happening around you - trying to keep your cool

Wulbren_160.speaker: Player
Wulbren_160.text: I might have something that could help.

Wulbren_109.speaker: Player
Wulbren_109.text: I don't have time for this. You're on your own.

Wulbren_242.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_242.text: You've killed us, you prick of the absolute - stone dead.
Wulbren_242.context: NodeContext: full of hate and violence

Wulbren_225.speaker: Player
Wulbren_225.text: Not yet, I'll be back soon.

Wulbren_216.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_216.text: I should've taken charge of that damn boat - we'd be out of here by now.
Wulbren_216.context: NodeContext: tense and annoyed - just wants to leave

Wulbren_220.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_220.text: We're short on time, friend. Any luck with those tools?
Wulbren_220.context: NodeContext: glad to see player but also knows he's short on time - they need tools and need them now

Wulbren_251.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_251.context: NodeContext: furtive - speaking low. Player was spotted by guards, if it happens again they're done for

Warden_18.speaker: The Warden
Warden_18.text: You. Not you. Lord Ketheric may think you pose no threat to him in your disgrace, but I know the things you've done.

Warden_127.speaker: The Warden
Warden_127.text: Keep your bloody thoughts to yourself and your head down.

Warden_47.speaker: Player
Warden_47.text: How in the Hells do you know me?

Warden_117.speaker: The Warden
Warden_117.text: You set foot in our tower once. You did not leave, at least not through any door I have watch over.

Warden_90.speaker: The Warden
Warden_90.text: I assumed you overstayed your welcome. Little did I expect you to intrude again.

Warden_32.speaker: The Warden
Warden_32.text: Your name, your place was kept from all of us last time, but you were to be shown the utmost of respect.

Warden_26.speaker: The Warden
